intro: Chenolea villosa, commonly known as the hairy chenolea, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely hairy stems and leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its small, white or yellowish flowers are arranged in umbels, a common feature in the Apiaceae family. Chenolea villosa is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
